fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.gui

Class InventoryGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.gui.GuiBase
      • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.components.gui.InventoryGui
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionGui

    public abstract class InventoryGui
extends GuiBase
    This class provides the basic needs for chest-type GUIs. It allows you to create custom GUIs by simply providing an inventory to fill, as well as rerouting basic events to it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  InventoryGui.InventoryGuiListener
      Implements a Bukkit listener for all GUI-related events.

    • Method Detail

      • affectsGui

        protected static boolean affectsGui(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryDragEvent event)
        Returns if the given event affects the GUI's inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to test
        Returns:
        true if any of the event's slots is in the GUI's inventory, false otherwise.

      • affectsGui

        protected static boolean affectsGui(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Returns if the given event affects the GUI's inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to test
        Returns:
        true if the event's slot is in the GUI's inventory, false otherwise.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Asks the GUI to recreate its view. The inventory is cleared, but never regenerated when calling this method.

      • open

        protected void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Overrides:

        public void close()
        Closes this inventory.

        close in class GuiBase

      • onClick

        protected abstract void onClick(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Raised when an action is performed on an item in the inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - The click event data.

      • onDrag

        protected void onDrag(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryDragEvent event)
        Raised when an drag is performed on the inventory. The default behaviour is to cancel any event that affects the GUI.
        Parameters:
        event - The drag event data.

      • update

        public void update()
        Asks the GUI to update its data, and refresh its view accordingly. The inventory may be regenerated when calling this method.
        Overrides:
        update in class GuiBase

      • getSize

        protected final int getSize()
        Gets the size of the inventory.
        Returns:
        The size of the inventory.

      • setSize

        protected final void setSize(int size)
        Sets the new size of the inventory. The given value is raised to be a multiple of the size of an inventory's row, and is capped to the maximal size of an inventory. It will be applied on the next GUI update.
        Parameters:
        size - The new size of the inventory.

      • setHeight

        protected final void setHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the inventory. The given value is capped to the maximal height of an inventory. It will be applied on the next GUI update. This is a shortcut for setSize(height * INVENTORY_ROW_SIZE).
        Parameters:
        height - The new height of the inventory.
        See Also:
        setSize(int)

      • getTitle

        protected String getTitle()
        Returns the title of the inventory.
        Returns:
        The title of the inventory.

      • setTitle

        protected void setTitle(String title)
        Sets the new title of the inventory. It will be applied on the next GUI update.
        Parameters:
        title - The new title of the inventory

      • getInventory

        public org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory getInventory()
        Gets the underlying inventory, or null if the Gui has not been opened yet.
        Returns:
        The underlying inventory, or null if the Gui has not been opened yet.
